title: Colorado License Plate Fonts
content:
Wanted to see if anyone knows what two fonts are used on the Colorado license plate.

I'm pretty sure a good fit for the main license number is: LicensePlate.ttf @ [http://www.fontspace.com/dave-hansen/license-plate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226170537/http:/www.fontspace.com/dave-hansen/license-plate "http://www.fontspace.com/dave-hansen/license-plate")

What's your thoughts, especially with the word 'Colorado?'

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [license plate.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226170537/http:/typophile.com/files/license%20plate.jpg) | 52.27 KB |
author: khedaywi

comments.content:
Well, LicensePlate is totally different from the numbers on the plate. Look at the D, for example.

I'm not sure about the state name. Maybe someone else will recognize the odd letter shapes in it.
Thanks man. Any assistance on the word 'Colorado?'

Colorado appears similar to Houschka Rounded:  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?NGU](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226170537/http:/www.identifont.com/show?NGU "http://www.identifont.com/show?NGU")

More on license plates font (the difficult part is getting the serifed D along the sans serif A):  
 [http://www.leewardpro.com/articles/licplatefonts/licplate-fonts-nam.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226170537/http:/www.leewardpro.com/articles/licplatefonts/licplate-fonts-nam.html "http://www.leewardpro.com/articles/licplatefonts/licplate-fonts-nam.html")  
 [http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=57](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226170537/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=57 "http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=57")
